Package iscteiul.ista

Class PropertyUtils

java.lang.Object
iscteiul.ista.PropertyUtils
public final class PropertyUtils extends Object
A stateless utility class providing helper methods to work with PropertyRecord objects.

Typical usage: filtering properties by owner, by municipality, checking adjacency among them, etc.

All methods are static (no internal state).

      Filters PropertyRecord objects by a given municipality name (case-sensitive).
      Parameters:
      records - the list of all PropertyRecord objects
      municipality - the municipality to match; if null, returns empty list

    • arePropertiesAdjacent

      public static boolean arePropertiesAdjacent(PropertyRecord a, PropertyRecord b)
      Checks if two PropertyRecords are adjacent (touching) by delegating to GeometryUtils. Returns false if either geometry is missing/null.
      Parameters:
      a - the first PropertyRecord
      b - the second PropertyRecord
      Returns:
      true if they are adjacent (touch), false otherwise

    • findAdjacentProperties

      Parameters:
      record - the reference PropertyRecord
      records - the list of all PropertyRecord objects to check
      Returns:
      a List of PropertyRecords that touch the given record

      public static Set<String> getDistinctParishes(List<PropertyRecord> records)

      Parameters:
      records - the list of PropertyRecord objects
      Returns:
      a Set of unique parish strings, or an empty set if records is null or no parishes

      Returns:

      Parameters:

      parish - the parish name to filter by; case-sensitive
      Returns:
      a new list of PropertyRecord objects in the specified parish

      Calculates the average area of the given list of PropertyRecord objects.
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      the average area, or 0.0 if the list is null or empty

    • groupPropertiesByOwner

      public static Map<Integer,List<PropertyRecord>> groupPropertiesByOwner(List<PropertyRecord> properties)
      Groups a list of PropertyRecord objects by their owner ID.
      Parameters:
      properties - the list of PropertyRecord objects
      Returns:
      a map where the key is the owner ID and the value is a list of properties owned by that owner

    • calculateAverageGroupedArea

      public static double calculateAverageGroupedArea(List<PropertyRecord> records, org.jgrapht.Graph<PropertyRecord,org.jgrapht.graph.DefaultEdge> fullGraph)
      Calculates the average area of connected property groups for each owner.

      For each owner, builds a subgraph of their properties, identifies connected groups, and computes the total area for each group. Returns the average of these group areas.

      Parameters:
      records - the list of PropertyRecord objects
      fullGraph - the full graph of properties and their connections
      Returns:
      the average area of connected property groups, or 0.0 if no groups are found

    • distanceToFunchal

      public static double distanceToFunchal(int propertyId)
      Computes the distance between the centroids of the given property (by its objectID) and the pre-loaded Funchal (SÃ©) reference property stored in App.getFunchalPropertyRecord().

      This method no longer accepts a list of properties as an argument. Instead, it retrieves all records via App.getPropertyRecords().

      Important: This uses geometry.getCentroid() from JTS, which returns the centroid in the same coordinate system as the geometry. If your data is lat/lon (EPSG:4326), you'll get the result in degrees; for meters, you must have a projected coordinate system.

      Parameters:
      propertyId - the objectID of the source property whose centroid distance to the Funchal (SÃ©) reference we want
      Returns:
      the distance between centroids as a double; Double.NaN if the property or Funchal reference is missing/invalid, or if geometry parse fails

    • distanceToMachico

      public static double distanceToMachico(int propertyId)
      Computes the distance between the centroids of the given property (by its objectID) and the pre-loaded Machico reference property stored in App.getMachicoPropertyRecord().

      This method no longer accepts a list of properties as an argument. Instead, it retrieves all records via App.getPropertyRecords().

      Important: This uses geometry.getCentroid() from JTS, which returns the centroid in the same coordinate system as the geometry. If your data is lat/lon (EPSG:4326), you'll get the result in degrees; for meters, you must have a projected coordinate system.

      Parameters:
      propertyId - the objectID of the source property whose centroid distance to the Machico reference we want
      Returns:
      the distance between centroids as a double; Double.NaN if the property or Machico reference is missing/invalid, or if geometry parse fails

    • mergeAdjacentPropertiesSameOwner

      public static List<PropertyRecord> mergeAdjacentPropertiesSameOwner(List<PropertyRecord> properties)
      Merges properties belonging to the same owner if they are adjacent (touching).

      The result is a new list of PropertyRecord in which each connected component of properties (same owner + adjacency) is replaced by a single merged property. This method:

      • Uses a JGraphT SimpleGraph to link properties that have the same owner and are adjacent;
      • Finds connected components with JGraphT's ConnectivityInspector;
      • For each connected set, identifies the property with the largest shapeArea (the "representative") whose metadata (objectID, parcelID, etc.) the merged property will inherit;
      • Computes the union (via JTS) of all geometries in the connected set, recalculating shapeArea and shapeLength from the union. If the union yields a single polygon, it is wrapped as a MULTIPOLYGON;
      • Returns a list of PropertyRecord, one per connected set, adopting the largest property's metadata but holding the combined geometry.

      Any property that shares no adjacency with others of the same owner will simply appear unchanged in the resulting list (i.e., no merge occurs).

      Parameters:
      properties - a list of PropertyRecord to potentially merge, typically all from the same parish, but this method will handle any set of properties
      Returns:
      a new list of merged PropertyRecord, where each connected component of same-owner, adjacent properties has been replaced by a single record. This record uses the ID, parcelID, etc. of the largest-area member. Geometry is unioned. The returned geometry is guaranteed to be a MULTIPOLYGON if one or more polygons were merged.
